arch:property.oc:show_val: Fill in northwest section of the trench. It abutted two mud brick collapses, L2020 (to the East) & L2013 (to the south). During its excavation a mud brick wall, which can be seen in the north baulk, was destroyed. It had some hard areas, but the collapse it abutted always seemed more dense and hard than anything contained in the locus. It was finally closed when the mudbrick on both sides was razed. The area under those walls and fill was then changed to a new locus. Two nice mixed together potsmashes were found, but no concrete surface.
Grainy. Many fine grains, but the mix is poorly sorted, mud wash
No pebbles or rocks. Poorly sorted, sandy. Varies from silt to small clods.
Two large potsmashes. A surface could appear imminently.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area B / Trench 2 / Locus 2032 (Locus)
